t: Yearning for God in the Midst of Distresses
To the Chief Musician. A Contemplation of the sons of Korah.
As*pn the deer pants for the water brooks, So*ld pants my soul for You, O God.
My*ld soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When*ld shall I come and appear before God?
My*ld tears have been my food day and night, While*ld they continually say to me, “Where*ld is*i your God?”

When*ln I remember these things,*i I*ld pour out my soul within me. For*ld I used to go with the multitude; I*ld went with them to the house of God, With*ld the voice of joy and praise, With*ld a multitude that kept a pilgrim feast.
Why*ln are you cast down, O my soul? And*ld why*i are you disquieted within me? Hope*ld in God, for I shall yet praise Him For*ild the help of His countenance.
O*ln my God, my soul is cast down within me; Therefore*ld I will remember You from the land of the Jordan, And*ld from the heights of Hermon, From*ld the Hill Mizar.
Deep*ld calls unto deep at the noise of Your waterfalls; All*ld Your waves and billows have gone over me.
The*ld Lord*s will command His lovingkindness in the daytime, And*ld in the night His song shall*i be*i with me— A*ld prayer to the God of my life.
I*ln will say to God my Rock, “Why*ld have You forgotten me? Why*ld do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
As*ild with a breaking of my bones, My*ld enemies reproach me, While*ld they say to me all day long, “Where*ld is*i your God?”
Why*ln are you cast down, O my soul? And*ld why are you disquieted within me? Hope*ld in God; For*ld I shall yet praise Him, The*ld help of my countenance and my God.
